text.headline:
Patient Pathways Interactive
Patient A
text.text: Instructions: You can view the progression in a linear fashion by using the left and right arrows on desktop or swipe on mobile. Additionally, you can slide the timeline to move forward or back in time. Use the magnifying glass to scale the timeline as needed

text.headline: Presentation / ER
text.text:
• 19 year old female patient presented to ED
  • 5/7 vomiting,fevers,intermittent abdominal pain,myalgia,weakness

Vital signs

  • RR 22/min,Sats 94% O2
  • HR 140-150 bpm SR
  • GCS 15/15

Past medical History

  • 6 weeks ago came to UK from Brazil
  • PartnJIp01_01ER_ECG1.jpger witnessed that she c/o palpitations occasionally & joint pains

text.headline: Escalation of management
text.text:
On presentation she was in extremis: she was hypoxic, acidotic and hypotensive and therefore she was referred for ECMO

  • PH 7.30(7.35-7.45)
  • PCO2 5.88(4.5-6)
  • PO2 11.9(9.5-14)
  • HCO3 20.9(22-30)

text.headline:
QUIZ:
What investigations should take place next?
ICU epoch

text.headline: YouTube link JACC: Heart Failure Virtual Journal Club
text.text: In part one of JACC: Heart Failure's first Virtual Journal Club, Drs. Scott Solomon, Jonathan Cunningham, James Januzzi and Nasrien Ibrahim  includes the presentation of two recent manuscripts in the journals focused on natriuretic peptides. Subsequent discussion led by Editor-in-Chief Dr. Christopher O'Connor reveals the inner workings of the Editorial Board assessment and interaction with the senior and junior authors. Learn more on JACC.org: https://bit.ly/2XgBVdk
